definition: to wash/to rinse/any of three 10-day division of the month (during Tang dynasty)/Taiwan pr. [huan3]/also pr. [wan3]
Huansahji or Washing the Silken Gauze, Yuan and Ming saga reworked by 梁辰魚|梁辰鱼 from History of the Southern States Wu and Yue, 吳越春秋|吴越春秋, a popular opera subject

sentences.english: As she was extremely beautiful, when she went to the river to wash the gauze.
sentences.chinese: 因为长得非常漂亮，西施在河里浣纱的时候。

sentences.english: Tai Hang Veterinary Clinic, G/F, 9 Wun Sha Street, Tai Hang, Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 大坑兽医诊所，香港大坑浣纱街9号地下。

definition: Nichang, abbr. for the Tang Dynasty song "Raiment of Rainbows and Feathers" 霓裳羽衣曲[Ni2 chang2 yu3 yi1 qu1] or 霓裳羽衣舞[Ni2 chang2 yu3 yi1 wu3]
nichang, rainbow colored clothes worn by the Eight Immortals 八仙[Ba1 xian1]
(literary) (of a woman) to have a graceful demeanor/beautiful woman
lit. boat made of lily magnolia wood/poetic term for boat
a beautiful woman/graceful and elegant posture/moon
